summary: The Ark of the Covenant is a sacred object from the biblical past. It was a golden chest where the Israelites kept the Ten Commandments, Aaron's rod, and manna. Moses received instructions from God on Mount Sinai to build it. The Ark was carried by the Levites during their journey. It was believed to be very powerful and holy. Scholars today discuss its historical existence and possible influences, like Egyptian or Bedouin culture.
title: Ark of the Covenant
